com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class ListViewSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ViewSettings
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ListViewSettings

  • public final class ListViewSettings
extends ViewSettings
    Defines properties that allow customizing the visualization of the calendar in a List view.

      • getNumberOfCells

        public java.lang.Integer getNumberOfCells()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the total number of cells to be displayed in the List view.

        This value cannot be less than 1 or less than the number of visible days as specified by ListViewSettings.getVisibleCells().

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying how many days to display.

      • setNumberOfCells

        public void setNumberOfCells(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets the total number of cells to be displayed in the List view.

        This value cannot be less than 1 or less than the number of visible days as specified by ListViewSettings.getVisibleCells().

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying how many days to display. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getVisibleCells

        public java.lang.Integer getVisibleCells()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the number of cells visible at the same time.

        This value cannot be less than 1 or less than the total number of days available in the view, as specified by ListViewSettings.getNumberOfCells().

        Returns:
        A positive integer value specifying how many days to display simultaneously in the list view.

      • setVisibleCells

        public void setVisibleCells(java.lang.Integer value)

        Parameters:

      • getHeaderSize

        public java.lang.Integer getHeaderSize()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the header size in pixels.

        This value specifies the header width if ListViewSettings.getOrientation() is Horizontal or the height if ListViewSettings.getOrientation() is Vertical.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the header size. A value of 0 hides the header.

      • getOrientation

        public Orientation getOrientation()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the cells are displayed horizontally or vertically.

        If this property is set to Horizontal, the view header is displayed at the top and the day cells are arranged in a horizontal row underneath it. If set to Vertical, the header is displayed on the left side and the days are arranged in a vertical row on the right.

        Returns:
        One of the Orientation constants.

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(Orientation value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the cells are displayed horizontally or vertically.

        If this property is set to Horizontal, the view header is displayed at the top and the day cells are arranged in a horizontal row underneath it. If set to Vertical, the header is displayed on the left side and the days are arranged in a vertical row on the right.

        Parameters:
        value - One of the Orientation constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getItemOrientation

        public Orientation getItemOrientation()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the items are displayed horizontally, vertically or according to the orientation of the view.

        Items are usually oriented according to the view's orientation as specified by ListViewSettings.getOrientation(). That is, items are horizontal in a horizontal List view and vice versa. The orientation of the items can be explicitly specified by using this property.

        Returns:
        One of the Orientation constants.

      • setItemOrientation

        public void setItemOrientation(Orientation value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the items are displayed horizontally, vertically or according to the orientation of the view.

        Items are usually oriented according to the view's orientation as specified by ListViewSettings.getOrientation(). That is, items are horizontal in a horizontal List view and vice versa. The orientation of the items can be explicitly specified by using this property.

        Parameters:
        value - One of the Orientation constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getSubTitleFormat

        public java.lang.String getSubTitleFormat()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a string used to format the subtitle texts.

        In addition to the standard specifiers, the "w1" format can be used to display only the first letter of the day of the week (that is, 'M' for Monday, 'T' for Tuesday, and so on). This specifier cannot be combined with other specifiers, it can be used only by its own.

        Returns:
        A string specifying the display format.

      • setSubTitleFormat

        public void setSubTitleFormat(java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a string used to format the subtitle texts.

        In addition to the standard specifiers, the "w1" format can be used to display only the first letter of the day of the week (that is, 'M' for Monday, 'T' for Tuesday, and so on). This specifier cannot be combined with other specifiers, it can be used only by its own.

        Parameters:
        value - A string specifying the display format. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        public java.lang.Integer getHeaderShadowOffset()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.
        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the distance between a header and its shadow. The allowed values range from 1 to 5.

      • getVisibleColumns

        public java.lang.Integer getVisibleColumns()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the number of visible group columns in a list view.

        This value is used only when the view is grouped. Otherwise, the number of columns is always 1.

        Returns:
        A positive integer value specifying the number of columns visible at the same time.

      • setVisibleColumns

        public void setVisibleColumns(java.lang.Integer value)

        This value is used only when the view is grouped. Otherwise, the number of columns is always 1.

        Parameters:
        value - A positive integer value specifying the number of columns visible at the same time. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getGroupHeaderSize

        public java.lang.Integer getGroupHeaderSize()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the size of the group header.

        A value of 0 causes the calendar to automatically calculate a header size based on the size of the header font.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the size of the header in pixels.

      • setGroupHeaderSize

        public void setGroupHeaderSize(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets the size of the group header.

        A value of 0 causes the calendar to automatically calculate a header size based on the size of the header font.

        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying the size of the header in pixels. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnableSnapping

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableSnapping()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether custom snapping is enabled.

        When this property is enabled, the users will move and resize items with the precision specified by ListViewSettings.getSnapUnit() instead of the precision of the view's resolution. When this property is disabled, the items will snap automatically to the border of their containing cells.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableSnapping

        public void setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether custom snapping is enabled.

        When this property is enabled, the users will move and resize items with the precision specified by ListViewSettings.getSnapUnit() instead of the precision of the view's resolution. When this property is disabled, the items will snap automatically to the border of their containing cells.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getFreeDrag

        public java.lang.Boolean getFreeDrag()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether users can drag items anywhere in the view, not only in the first unoccupied row.

        Set this property to true to disable the default item layout algorithm, where colliding items are arranged relative to each other according to their start and end times and their Priority. Turning this property on will allow users to move items anywhere within the view.

        The position of an item within the view can be obtained and set programmatically through the use of the Calendar.getItemListLane(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Item) and Calendar.setItemListLane(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Item, int) methods.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setFreeDrag

        public void setFreeDrag(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether users can drag items anywhere in the view, not only in the first unoccupied row.

        Set this property to true to disable the default item layout algorithm, where colliding items are arranged relative to each other according to their start and end times and their Priority. Turning this property on will allow users to move items anywhere within the view.

        The position of an item within the view can be obtained and set programmatically through the use of the Calendar.getItemListLane(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Item) and Calendar.setItemListLane(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Item, int) methods.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnableVirtualItemSpace

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableVirtualItemSpace()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether items in the list view can be scrolled through.

        Use this property to override the default behavior of the vertical scrollbar (in a horizontal List view) or the horizontal scrollbar (in a vertical List view). When this property is enabled, the appropriate scrollbar will scroll through the items that are not visible within the view (due to insufficient space) rather than scroll through the cells associated with resources in a grouped List view.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableVirtualItemSpace

        public void setEnableVirtualItemSpace(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether items in the list view can be scrolled through.

        Use this property to override the default behavior of the vertical scrollbar (in a horizontal List view) or the horizontal scrollbar (in a vertical List view). When this property is enabled, the appropriate scrollbar will scroll through the items that are not visible within the view (due to insufficient space) rather than scroll through the cells associated with resources in a grouped List view.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getTotalLaneCount

        public java.lang.Integer getTotalLaneCount()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the number of lanes in a List view whose ListViewSettings.getEnableVirtualItemSpace() is true.

        When this property is set to 0, the item scrollbar is automatically adjusted so that it covers all existing items. Otherwise the item scrollbar is adjusted so that it covers the specified number of lanes.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the number of lanes in the view.

      • setTotalLaneCount

        public void setTotalLaneCount(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets the number of lanes in a List view whose ListViewSettings.getEnableVirtualItemSpace() is true.

        When this property is set to 0, the item scrollbar is automatically adjusted so that it covers all existing items. Otherwise the item scrollbar is adjusted so that it covers the specified number of lanes.

        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying the number of lanes in the view. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getShowNavigationButtons

        public java.lang.Boolean getShowNavigationButtons()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the List view displays navigation buttons.

        The size of the buttons can be controlled through the Calendar.setButtonSize(int) method of the Calendar class. The amount of units to scroll can be specified through ListViewSettings.setScrollStep(java.lang.Integer) property.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setShowNavigationButtons

        public void setShowNavigationButtons(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the List view displays navigation buttons.

        The size of the buttons can be controlled through the Calendar.setButtonSize(int) method of the Calendar class. The amount of units to scroll can be specified through ListViewSettings.setScrollStep(java.lang.Integer) property.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getScrollStep

        public java.lang.Integer getScrollStep()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the number of units to scroll when the user clicks the navigation buttons.

        This property specifies the amount of units (as specified by ListViewSettings.getCellUnits()) to scroll back and forth when using the navigation buttons in the List view.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the number of units to scroll.

      • setScrollStep

        public void setScrollStep(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets the number of units to scroll when the user clicks the navigation buttons.

        This property specifies the amount of units (as specified by ListViewSettings.getCellUnits()) to scroll back and forth when using the navigation buttons in the List view.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the number of units to scroll. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getSubHeaderDivisions

        public java.lang.Integer getSubHeaderDivisions()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the number of divisions in the sub-header.

        The value of this property is used only when the subheader of the List view is displayed (as specified by ListViewSettings.getHeaderStyle()). The value specifies the number of cells in the subheader. The date in each cell is calculated automatically and is displayed according to ListViewSettings.getSubTitleFormat().

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the number of cells in the subheader.

      • setSubHeaderDivisions

        public void setSubHeaderDivisions(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets the number of divisions in the sub-header.

        The value of this property is used only when the subheader of the List view is displayed (as specified by ListViewSettings.getHeaderStyle()). The value specifies the number of cells in the subheader. The date in each cell is calculated automatically and is displayed according to ListViewSettings.getSubTitleFormat().

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the number of cells in the subheader. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getSnapUnit

        public TimeUnit getSnapUnit()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets the snap unit.

        Use this property in a conjunction with ListViewSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) to specify the precision with which users can move and resize items interactively. If ListViewSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) is set to false the value of this property is ignored and items snap to cell borders.

        Returns:
        One of the TimeUnit constants.

      • setSnapUnit

        public void setSnapUnit(TimeUnit value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets the snap unit.

        Use this property in a conjunction with ListViewSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) to specify the precision with which users can move and resize items interactively. If ListViewSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) is set to false the value of this property is ignored and items snap to cell borders.

        Parameters:
        value - One of the TimeUnit constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnableMilestoneMode

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableMilestoneMode()
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether milestone item rendering mode is turned on. When in this mode, items are not rendered as ribbons but rather as small squares in the cell where the items start.
        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableMilestoneMode

        public void setEnableMilestoneMode(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ListViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether milestone item rendering mode is turned on. When in this mode, items are not rendered as ribbons but rather as small squares in the cell where the items start.
        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.
